page.title: 17Local Transport
page.content: For transport to our local shops my Mum uses her car or walks. If we want a days shopping in Wolverhampton or Birmingham we take Dad's car. There is no passenger train service in Hednesford so we always travel by car when visiting friends and relations. When we go to London we go by car to Stafford and then go by train. My friends and I use our bikes to go visiting each other. Hednesford station used to be open to passengers, but now it is used for transporting coal during the week, and special excursions some weekends in summer. There is a very good local bus service provided by four companies. Buses to Cannock and Rugeley run about every half hour, and to Birmingham and Wolverhampton every hour. 60% of our class own a car, 17% own two cars,and 23% do not own a car.
